What crops is this useful for?: This product is formulated exclusively for the control of tobacco suckers.
First aid information?: If in eyes, hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. If on skin or clothing, rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. If swallowed, call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice. If inhaled, move person to fresh air.
What special restrictions are placed on: Do not apply directly to water, to areas where surface water is present or to intertidal areas below the mean high water mark. Do not apply this product through any type of irrigation system. Do not contaminate water when disposing of equipment washwaters or rinsate.
What PPE should I wear?: Wear protective eyewear, (goggles or face shield). Avoid contact with skin, eyes, or clothing. Avoid inhalation of mist. Wear long-sleeved shirt and long pants, shoes and socks, and chemical resistant gloves.
How, where, and on what crop should I us: FST-7 should be applied during early morning after the dew dries, all day on cloudy days, avoiding late afternoon or night applications. Do not apply FST-7 when the wind velocity is high enough to turn the top leaves. Do not apply during a rain or when the leaves are still wet or when rain is predicted during the period of 6 hours for absorption throughout the entire plant. Do not make more than one application per season. The maximum use rate is 6 lb. ai/A/year.
How does the product have to be stored o: Do not stack over 2 pallets high. Store original containers in cool dry place away from food, water and feed. Pesticide wastes resulting from the use of this product may be disposed of on site or at an approved waste disposal facility.
